meanings.definition: A person who delivers a long, passionate speech or lecture.
meanings.sent1: The haranguers at the rally captivated the audience with their powerful speeches.
meanings.sent2: The political haranguers often speak for hours on end to persuade their listeners.
meanings.sent3: The haranguers in the debate club always have a lot to say about various topics.
meanings.sent4: The haranguers in the courtroom presented their arguments with great fervor.
meanings.sent5: The history teacher was known as one of the most engaging haranguers in the school.

meanings.definition: To deliver a long, passionate speech or lecture.
meanings.sent1: She haranguers her classmates about the importance of recycling every week.
meanings.sent2: The politician haranguers the crowd with promises of change during the campaign.
meanings.sent3: The teacher haranguers the students about the benefits of studying hard.
meanings.sent4: The coach haranguers the team to give their best effort in the upcoming game.
meanings.sent5: He haranguers the audience with his fiery speeches on social justice.
